column3: While reverting this should be conceptually fine, as the mempool bug can only be observed when polling the RPC *and* reorging the chain, this is no longer a clean `git revert`. Thus, I wonder why we prefer to potentially introduce a bug in bitcoind to avoid a fix in the GUI code.\n\nIf #17135 brings down the frequency of the "not responding" pop ups to a 0.18.0 level, it should be preferred, imo
I think DrahtBot filters pull requests for `branch==master`
Clean revert is not possible. I tend to agree with Marco.

> If #17135 brings down the frequency of the "not responding" pop ups to a 0.18.0 level, it should be preferred, imo.\n\nYes, to be honest both solutions are too involved for between RCs. I think we should just skip this for 0.19.0, leave fixing this properly for 0.19.1.
Well at least I'm not comfortable with this one.
